entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character, who is looking at the snake and trying to interact with it. (Excerpt: 'He moved in front of the tank and looked intently at the snake.')

entities.name: dudley
entities.description: Harry's cousin, who is bored and wants to leave. (Excerpt: '‘This is boring,’ Dudley moaned. He shuffled away .')

entities.name: uncle vernon
entities.description: Harry's uncle, who is present in the scene but not directly interacting with the snake. (Excerpt: 'The snake jerked its head towards Uncle Vernon and Dudley ,')

entities.name: snake
entities.description: A pet snake that is being kept in a tank, which seems to be bored with the people watching it. (Excerpt: 'He wouldn’t have been surprised if it had died of boredom itself – no company except stupid people drumming their fingers on the glass trying to disturb it all day long.')

entities.name: aunt petunia
entities.description: Harry's aunt, who is mentioned as someone who would wake him up in his bedroom. (Excerpt: 'It was worse than having a cupboard as a bedroom, where the only visitor was Aunt Petunia hammering on the door to wake you up')

relationships.description: Harry is interacting with the snake, trying to get its attention and even winking at it. (Excerpt: 'He looked quickly around to see if anyone was watching. They weren’t. He looked back at the snake and winked, too.')
The snake is giving attention to Uncle Vernon, but in a dismissive way. (Excerpt: 'It jerked its head towards Uncle Vernon and Dudley , then raised its eyes to the ceiling.')
The snake is also giving attention to Dudley, but in a similar dismissive way. (Excerpt: 'It jerked its head towards Uncle Vernon and Dudley , then raised its eyes to the ceiling.')
